meanings.definition: The quality or state of being organic.
meanings.sent1: The organicity of the soil made it perfect for growing vegetables.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the organicity of different materials to understand their composition.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the secret ingredient in her dish was a sprinkle of organicity.
meanings.sent4: The organicity of the forest was evident in the vibrant colors of the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The farmer emphasized the importance of maintaining the organicity of the farm for sustainable practices.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being derived from living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The organicity of the medicine ensured it was safe for consumption.
meanings.sent2: Food labels often highlight the organicity of the ingredients used.
meanings.sent3: The artist's painting seemed to capture the essence of organicity in nature.
meanings.sent4: The organicity of the fabric made it soft and comfortable to wear.
meanings.sent5: The organicity of the perfume came from the natural oils used in its production.

meanings.definition: The property of being composed of organic compounds.
meanings.sent1: The organicity of the fertilizer promoted healthy growth in the plants.
meanings.sent2: Chemists analyze the organicity of substances to determine their reactivity.
meanings.sent3: The bakery prided itself on the organicity of its bread, made with whole grains.
meanings.sent4: The organicity of the skincare product came from its plant-based ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The organicity of the compost helped enrich the soil in the garden.
